intro: Cakile serapionis, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the western United States. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has pinnately divided leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss. Its seeds are enclosed in small, dry pods and are dispersed by wind. Cakile serapionis is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to harsh environmental conditions.
